twitter.skeleton:
1/ [Hook - surprising fact or question that stops the scroll]

2/ [Context - why this matters, who should care]

3-5/ [Key insights, one per tweet, building on each other]

6/ [Synthesis - what this means for the reader]

7/ [Call to action or open question]

Style: Direct, technical but accessible, occasional dry humor. No emoji spam.
examples:
1/ Spiking neural networks are having a moment, and most people are missing why.

2/ The dirty secret of modern ML: we're burning 1000x more compute than biology because we ignored spikes.

...

twitter.skeleton:
1/ [Hook - start in the middle of the action]

2-4/ [Build the story with specific details]

5/ [The turn - what changed, what you learned]

6/ [The takeaway - why this matters]

Style: Personal, specific, honest about uncertainty.

twitter.description: Single tweet with one sharp insight
twitter.skeleton:
[One clear thought, < 280 chars]

Make it:
- Specific enough to be interesting
- General enough to resonate
- Worth saving or sharing

twitter.description: Thoughtful reply to someone else's tweet
twitter.skeleton:
[Acknowledge their point]
[Add value - insight, example, or question]
[Keep it under 280 chars]

Don't: Be sycophantic, argue for argument's sake, promote yourself

[What happened? Be honest about limitations]

[Synthesis and open questions]
